paper_abstract: State-of-the-art MPI libraries rely on locks to guarantee thread-safety. This discourages application developers from using multiple threads to perform MPI operations. In this paper, we propose a high performance, lock-free multi-endpoint MPI runtime, which can achieve up to 40% improvement for point-to-point operation and one representative collective operation with minimum or no modifications to the existing applications.
paper_title: Initial Study of Multi-Endpoint Runtime for MPI plus OpenMP Hybrid Programming Model on Multi-Core Systems
